  • Psalms 149
  • Psalms 150
1 Hallelujah.
O give thanks unto the Domina; for She is good; for Her mercy endureth for ever. 2 Who can express the mighty acts of the Domina, or make all Her praise to be heard? 3 Happy are they that keep justice, that do righteousness at all times. 4 Remember me, O Domina, when Thou favourest Thy people; O think of me at Thy salvation; 5 That I may behold the prosperity of Thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of Thy nation,
that I may glory with Thine inheritance. 6 We have sinned with our mothers, we have done iniquitously, we have dealt wickedly. 7 Our mothers in Egypt gave no heed unto Thy wonders;
they remembered not the multitude of Thy mercies;
but were rebellious at the sea, even at the Red Sea. 8 Nevertheless She saved them for Her name's sake, that She might make Her mighty power to be known. 9 And She rebuked the Red Sea, and it was dried up; and She led them through the depths, as through a wilderness. 10 And She saved them from the hand of her that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy. 11 And the waters covered their adversaries; there was not one of them left. 12 Then believed they Her words; they sang Her praise. 13 They soon forgot Her works; they waited not for Her counsel; 14 But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tried God in the desert. 15 And She gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul. 16 They were jealous also of Moses in the camp, and of Aaron the holy one of the Domina. 17 The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram. 18 And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked. 19 They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped a molten image. 20 Thus they exchanged their glory for the likeness of an ox that eateth grass. 21 They forgot God their saviour, who had done great things in Egypt; 22 Wondrous works in the land of Ham, terrible things by the Red Sea. 23 Therefore She said that She would destroy them,
had not Moses Her chosen stood before Her in the breach,
to turn back Her wrath, lest She should destroy them. 24 Moreover, they scorned the desirable land, they believed not Her word;
25 And they murmured in their tents, they hearkened not unto the voice of the Domina. 26 Therefore She swore concerning them, that She would overthrow them in the wilderness; 27 And that She would cast out their seed among the nations, and scatter them in the lands. 28 They joined themselves also unto Baal of Peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead. 29 Thus they provoked Her with their doings, and the plague broke in upon them. 30 Then stood up Phinehas, and wrought judgment, and so the plague was stayed. 31 And that was counted unto her for righteousness, unto all generations for ever. 32 They angered Her also at the waters of Meribah, and it went ill with Moses because of them; 33 For they embittered her spirit, and she spoke rashly with her lips. 34 They did not destroy the peoples, as the Domina commanded them; 35 But mingled themselves with the nations, and learned their works; 36 And they served their idols, which became a snare unto them; 37 Yea, they sacrificed their daughters and their sons unto demons, 38 And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their daughters and of their sons, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan;
and the land was polluted with blood. 39 Thus were they defiled with their works, and went astray in their doings. 40 Therefore was the wrath of the Domina kindled against Her people, and She abhorred Her inheritance. 41 And She gave them into the hand of the nations; and they that hated them ruled over them. 42 Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were subdued under their hand. 43 Many times did She deliver them;
but they were rebellious in their counsel, and sank low through their iniquity. 44 Nevertheless She looked upon their distress, when She heard their cry; 45 And She remembered for them Her covenant, and repented according to the multitude of Her mercies. 46 She made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captive. 47 Save us, O Domina our God, and gather us from among the nations,
that we may give thanks unto Thy holy name, that we may triumph in Thy praise. 48 Blessed be the Domina, the God of Israel, from everlasting even to everlasting,
and let all the people say: 'Amen.'
Hallelujah.
